abstracts.cdata!:
The Catalytic Fund EFA/FTI Program for
            Lao PDR received a moderately satisfactory outcome rating
            with moderate risk to development outcome. The Bank received
            a moderately satisfactory performance rating while the
            Borrowers performance was rated satisfactory. There were
            two restructurings that took place during this project. The
            first restructuring moved a school feeding program into
            community grants disbursement category; added six districts
            to the program and reallocated funds. The second
            restructuring replaced the wording school feeding with
            school meals; extend closing date; modified the results
            framework and adjusted indicator targets; and reallocated
            funds. The following lessons were learned from this project:
            (1) Decentralization of school construction to remote rural
            communities increases ownership and commitment to education.
            (2) Mainstreaming implementation within government agencies
            requires ongoing capacity building. (3)
            Well-defined/well-targeted pilot activities can have a large
            impact when providing governments with tangible evidence.
            (4) Inclusion of analytical studies as part of project
            design is essential for providing guidance to decision
            makers on systemic reforms. (5) Strong financial management
            systems are critical for ensuring the efficient use and
            accounting of resources.
